meanings.definition: A person or thing that kicks.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was the best kicker in his soccer team.
meanings.sent2: The horse was a strong kicker when it felt threatened.
meanings.sent3: The robot kicker accidentally kicked the ball into the wrong goal.
meanings.sent4: The wind was a powerful kicker, sending leaves flying everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The kangaroo's powerful hind legs made it a skilled kicker.

meanings.definition: A sudden, surprising event or piece of information.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected rainstorm was a real kicker during the picnic.
meanings.sent2: Finding out about the surprise party was a great kicker for her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The sudden cancellation of the flight was a real kicker for the travelers.
meanings.sent4: The last-minute goal was the kicker that won the game for the underdog team.
meanings.sent5: The plot twist in the movie was a real kicker that left everyone shocked.

meanings.definition: A device for starting an engine by kicking a pedal.
meanings.sent1: The old motorcycle required a strong kicker to start the engine.
meanings.sent2: He used the kicker on his scooter to start it up and ride to work.
meanings.sent3: The vintage car's kicker was rusty and needed a hard kick to work.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic fixed the broken kicker on the lawnmower with a new part.
meanings.sent5: She struggled to use the kicker on the dirt bike to get it running smoothly.

meanings.definition: A player responsible for kicking the ball in sports like football or soccer.
meanings.sent1: The team's best kicker scored the winning goal in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The soccer coach trained the kicker to improve their accuracy and power.
meanings.sent3: The football kicker's shoe flew off mid-kick, causing laughter on the field.
meanings.sent4: The star kicker's powerful kick sent the ball soaring into the net.
meanings.sent5: The young kicker practiced diligently to become the team's top scorer.
